content.question: A negative charge is placed on a metal object as shown above. Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> are located at different points on the object. The radius of curvature of the objectâ€™s surface at Point <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> is greater than that at Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, which is greater than that at Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>. The electric potential at points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> is <math alttext="V sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="V sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. Rank the electric potential at each of these points.

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub Z is greater than V sub Y, which is greater than V sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub X is greater than V sub Y, which is greater than V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub Z equals V sub Y, which is greater than V sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub X equals V sub Y, which equals V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub X equals V sub Y, which equals V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
